name: Aptonoth
description: Placid, crested herbivorous monsters. They form herds and raise their young as a community.

name: Velociprey
description: Carnivorous monsters with vivid blue scales. They hunt in packs using a deadly mix of strength and cunning.

name: Konchu (Yellow)
description: Neopterons that roam in search of food. Coloration varies based on habitat, this variety being sandy yellow.

name: Kelbi
description: Diminutive herbivorous monsters known for their kind nature. Their horns are said to be rich in nutrients.

name: Hermitaur
description: Small hard-shelled Carapaceons. Their brains are regarded as a delicacy in some regions.

name: Bullfango
description: Small, aggressive Fanged Beasts that attack humans on sight. An acquired taste, but the meat is in demand.

name: Velocidrome
description: Alpha monsters that lead the smaller Velociprey. Note their larger size, impressive frill, and sharper claws.

name: Arzuros
description: Bear-like monsters found in warm, damp environments. Can often be found catching fish from rivers.

name: Yian Kut-Ku
description: Monsters boasting ample beaks and fan-like ears that splay open when angered. Konchu are a staple food.

name: Blue Yian Kut-Ku
description: A Yian Kut-Ku subspecies. Their blue coloration and physical prowess set them apart from their pink kin.

name: Popo
description: Herd-forming Herbivores covered in long, thick fur. Popo meat is nutritious and prized by gourmands.

name: Zamite
description: A young Zamtrios. Uses its sharp teeth to bore into its prey before devouring it from the inside out.

name: Bnahabra (Green)
description: Versatile Neopterons whose coloration and abilities differ according to habitat. This one is a hardy green.

name: Konchu (Blue)
description: Neopterons that roam in search of food. Coloration varies based on habitat, this variety being an icy blue.

name: Lagombi
description: White Fanged Beasts with acute hearing. They slide on the ice at high speeds to chase down their prey.

name: Bulldrome
description: Powerful alpha monsters that lead Bullfango herds. They mow down their prey with their sturdy tusks.

name: Zamtrios
description: Amphibian monsters known for the astonishing changes that occur when they coat their bodies in icy armor.

name: Khezu
description: Loathsome Flying Wyverns dwelling mainly in caves. They generate and release electricity to deadly effect.

name: Red Khezu
description: Khezu subspecies with red bodies. Its electrical power is far more advanced than that of its white cousin.

name: Barrel Felyne
description: Trapped in barrels and unable to free themselves, these Felynes await rescue.

name: Apceros
description: Herbivores clad in sturdy, armor-like plates. Approach with caution to avoid a fierce and persistent chase.

name: Genprey
description: Green-and-orange Bird Wyverns that hunt in packs. They make good use of their paralyzing venom.

name: Ludroth
description: Aquatic female monsters. They form harems around large males, aggressively attacking interlopers.

name: Altaroth
description: Neopterons found in many habitats. They forage for fruit, mushrooms, and honey to take back to their nests.

name: Slagtoth (Green)
description: A green variety of Slagtoth. They store nutrients in the thick layers of skin that hang from their bodies.

name: Vespoid
description: Giant Wasp-like Neopterons with paralyzing stingers, which they use on any who stray too close.

name: Bnahabra (Brown)
description: Versatile Neopterons whose coloration and abilities differ according to habitat. This one is a sturdy brown.

name: Cephalos
description: Piscine Wyverns with acute hearing. They swim freely in the desert sands that their scales so resemble.

name: Gendrome
description: Alpha monsters that lead Genprey. Paralyzing venom tips their highly-developed fangs and claws.

name: Royal Ludroth
description: Royal Ludroth use their sponge-like neck scales to absorb water and prevent dehydration.

name: Gypceros
description: Crested Bird Wyverns. They strike their crests to generate blinding flashes and dazzle their enemies.

name: Nerscylla
description: Temnocerans that build nests of sticky webbing to ensnare prey, which they rend with their mandibles.

name: Shrouded Nerscylla
description: Temnocerans that inhabit desert areas. They lurk beneath the sands in order ambush unwary prey.

name: Qurupeco
description: Bird Wyverns with colorful plumage. Using thoracic vocal organs they imitate the calls of other monsters.

name: Rathian
description: Female Flying Wyverns dubbed Queens of the Land. Possess powerful legs, and deadly, poisonous tails.

name: Pink Rathian
description: A vivid, pink-scaled Rathian subspecies. Its tail attacks are far more powerful than those of a regular Rathian.

name: Daimyo Hermitaur
description: These armored Carapaceons use their hardened pincers like shields to fend off the attacks of their enemies.

name: Plum Daimyo Hermitaur
description: Armored Carapaceons that approach their prey with blinding speed and strike using their powerful claws.

name: Barroth
description: Barroth bury themselves in mud, but will not hesitate to attack those who disturb them in their bogs.

name: Cephadrome
description: Alpha monsters that lead Cephalos. Hardened black scales set them apart from the smaller Cephalos.

name: Diablos
description: Feared as tyrants of the desert, these Flying Wyverns attack any who stray into their territory.

name: Black Diablos
description: A formidable subspecies of Diablos. Females darken in the mating season so as to warn off other creatures.

name: Tigrex
description: Primeval in appearance, these Flying Wyverns are possessed of fearsome limbs, jaws and claws.

name: Barroth EX
description: Enhanced Barroth controlled by modified Kinship Stones. Implanted Flame Sacs allow them to breathe fire.

name: Slagtoth (Brown)
description: A brown variety of Slagtoth. They store nutrients in the thick layers of skin that hang from their bodies.

name: Bnahabra (Red)
description: Versatile Neopterons whose coloration and abilities differ according to habitat. This one is a lively red.

name: Konchu (Red)
description: Neopterons that roam in search of food. Coloration varies based on habitat, this variety being a rusty red.

name: Ioprey
description: Red-scaled Bird Wyverns that attack by excreting venom from their throat sacs which they spit at foes.

name: Uroktor
description: Young Leviathans dwelling in volcanoes. Scavengers by nature, they feed off the scraps left behind by others.

name: Iodrome
description: Alpha monsters that lead Ioprey. Their poison sacs allow them to attack by spitting an acrid venom.

name: Basarios
description: Juvenile form of a Gravios. Its most distinctive feature is the rock-hard carapace on its back.

name: Gravios
description: Flying Wyverns that inhabit volcanic regions. Capable of attacking with fiery breath and sleeping gas.

name: Uragaan
description: Brute Wyverns with mighty jaws. They spray the stones and ore which stick to them in deadly, explosive attacks.

name: Brute Tigrex
description: A black Tigrex subspecies. The force and range of its howl is even more fearsome than that of its cousins.

name: Agnaktor
description: Agnaktor use their tough beaks and powerful muscles to burrow into rock, moving freely through the earth.

name: Aptonoth EX
description: An artificially enhanced Aptonoth controlled by modified Kinship Stones. Armor-clad, fire-breathing.

name: Uroktor EX
description: An artificially enhanced Uroktor controlled by modified Kinship Stones. Paralyzingly venomous.

name: Uragaan EX
description: An artificially enhanced Uragaan controlled by modified Kinship Stones. Aggressively electrifying.

name: Agnaktor EX
description: An artificially enhanced Agnaktor controlled by modified Kinship Stones. Draconically destructive.

name: Gargwa
description: Placid Bird Wyverns raised as livestock. Their vestigial wings make them flightless.

name: Bnahabra (Blue)
description: Versatile Neopterons whose coloration and abilities differ according to habitat. This one is a deep blue.

name: Jaggi
description: Carnivorous Bird Wyverns. They hunt in packs, and the young males are typically smaller than the females.

name: Jaggia
description: Female Jaggi that live in packs, generally responsible for protecting the nest and raising the young.

name: Conga
description: Pink furred Fanged Beasts. They prefer to live in small, close-knit groups than large troops.

name: Konchu (Green)
description: Neopterons that roam in search of food. Coloration varies based on habitat, this variety being verdant green.

name: Great Thunderbug
description: Gigantic Thunderbugs that are raised in the bellies of Elder Dragons. Electrifyingly lethal.

name: Shakalaka
description: Lynians never seen without their masks. Specializing in camouflage, even spotting one is no easy task.

name: Great Jaggi
description: Alpha monsters that lead Jaggi. They issue complex commands to the pack via their howls.

name: Kecha Wacha
description: Fanged Beasts with limbs well adapted to swinging through the forest tree areas they inhabit.

name: Purple Ludroth
description: A subspecies of Royal Ludroth. Poison is stored in their spongy purple manes.

name: Yian Garuga
description: Bird Wyverns known for their hard shells and long manes. Aggressive, prone to attack unprovoked.

name: Congalala
description: Pink-furred Fanged Beasts. They let rip with almighty farts, the stench of which overwhelms opponents.

name: Emerald Congalala
description: A green-furred Congalala. Able to store even more prodigious quantities of gas than its pink brethren.

name: Crimson Qurupeco
description: Subspecies with vibrant red plumage. Flints in its wings allow it to release fearsome electrical attacks.

name: Black Gravios
description: This subspecies has a tough, black carapace. It is capable of discharging powerful blasts of heat.

name: Zinogre
description: Fanged Wyverns that store the electrical energy of the countless Thunderbugs that they gather.

name: Ruby Basarios
description: Basarios subspecies that coats its carapace with rare ore. It scatters this with great force during battle.

name: Nargacuga
description: Flying Wyverns residing in wooded areas. Fearfully fast, persistent, and sly, they excel at hunting prey.

name: Green Nargacuga
description: Dappled green fur serves as camouflage in the deep forests that this Nargacuga calls home.

name: Rathalos
description: Dubbed the King of the Skies, it dominates battle with its powerful wings and poison-tipped claws.

name: Azure Rathalos
description: A Rathalos subspecies. More mobile than its cousin, it attacks with matchless speed and ferocity.

name: Tigrex EX
description: Enhanced Tigrex controlled by modified Kinship Stones. Granted untold power by the Black Blight.

name: Purple Gypceros
description: A subspecies of Gypceros with a uniquely colored hide. It attacks by spitting highly venomous waste.

name: Ash Kecha Wacha
description: This subspecies has pale, multicolored fur. They make sport of their prey with the cunning of their attacks.

name: Lagiacrus
description: Leviathans atop the aquatic food chain, due in no small part to their ability to deliver electrical shocks.

name: Ivory Lagiacrus
description: A Lagiacrus subspecies adapted to life on land. Its beautiful white carapace belies its vicious nature.

name: Deviljho
description: Brute Wyverns that roam in search of food. Ferocious in the extreme, and relentless in pursuit of prey.

name: Baggi
description: Intelligent Bird Wyverns that hunt in packs, and use special bodily fluids to tranquilize their prey.

name: Great Dracophage Bug
description: Large Dracophage Bugs. Dragon Element energy is said to lie dormant within their bodies.

name: Remobra
description: Snake Wyverns that have mastered flight, and which soar in search of weakened prey to swoop upon.

name: Great Baggi
description: Bluish-white, crested Bird Wyverns. Their ruthless cunning makes them natural leaders of Baggi packs.

name: Jade Barroth
description: A subspecies of Barroth. Often seen in polar regions, bashing their crowns against the ice.

name: Barioth
description: Flying Wyverns that rule the frozen wastes. Spikily scaled wings and tail allow them to run effortlessly across ice.

name: Sand Barioth
description: A subspecies of Barioth. Its breath is strong enough to generate tornados among the desert sands.

name: Glacial Agnaktor
description: A subspecies of Agnaktor. With its tough scales, even the tundra presents no obstacle to their movement.

name: Stygian Zinogre
description: Feeding on Dracophage Bugs has given this subspecies access to unheard of brute strength.

name: Brachydios
description: Brute Wyvern coated in a volatile substance. Its saliva can be used to ignite this coat, with explosive results.

name: Rajang
description: Ultra-aggressive Fanged Beasts. Widely regarded as the pinnacle of unparalleled physical prowess.

name: Kirin
description: Lightning-wielding mystical creature. Classified as an Elder Dragon, but its true nature remains a mystery.

name: Versa Pietru
description: Legendary White Dragon. Lights up the skies, pierces through darkness; the very embodiment of hope.

name: Makili Pietru
description: Legendary black dragon. Darkens the skies, swallows up light; the very embodiment of despair.

name: Monoblos
description: Endowed with an impressive cranial horn. It uses its horn in brutal attacks, screeching ear-splitting war cries.

name: Seregios
description: Flying Wyvern known for its lustrous golden scales. Its scales can be launched at prey in high-speed attacks.

name: Gold Rathian
description: A rare Rathian subspecies. Its majestic golden sheen resembles the glow of the full moon.

name: Silver Rathalos
description: A rare Rathalos subspecies. Its piercing silver shimmer resembles the blazing sun.

name: Kushala Daora
description: Elder Dragon clad in metal plating. Generates storms wherever it goes. Getting close to it is no mean feat.

name: Teostra
description: Wreathed in flame and wielding blistering breath attacks, the Guild monitors its movements and moods.

name: Fatalis
description: Legendary black dragon shrouded in mystery. Many sought to challenge it, few lived to tell the tale...

name: Great Poogie
description: A variety of Poogie. Looks harmless, but rub it the wrong way, and there'll be hell to pay.

name: White Monoblos
description: Fiercer than its cousins, this white subspecies should be approached with the utmost caution.

name: Molten Tigrex
description: A rare Tigrex subspecies. Its existence is unconfirmed due to a lack of reliable, and living, eye-witness accounts.

name: Oroshi Kirin
description: Mythical beasts that few have encountered. It is said that temperatures around them plummet below zero.
